original: reg bya'o // reg bya dang lhan cig 'grogs nas tshor ba dang 'du shes dang sems pa'o //
analyzed: reg bya'o // reg bya dang lhan cig 'grogs nas tshor ba dang 'du shes dang sems pa'o //
translated: When tactile objects are accompanied by contact, they are also accompanied by feeling, perception, and volition.

original: de'ang dge sbyong dang bram ze 'di dag gis yang dag pa ji lta bar reg bya de nyid la kun tu lta bar byed de /🔽reg bya 'di dag ni /
analyzed: de'ang dge sbyong dang bram ze 'di dag gis yang dag pa ji lta bar reg bya de nyid la kun tu lta bar byed de / reg bya 'di dag ni /
translated: “Monks and brahmins, you should look at tactile objects in accordance with reality.

original: rtag pa dang brtan pa dang ther zug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa dang brtan pa dang ther zug pa ma yin no //
translated: Tactile objects are not permanent, stable, and enduring.

original: gang 'di la bdag gis tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la bskyed par gyur na /
analyzed: gang 'di la bdag gis tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la bskyed par gyur na /
translated: If I were to generate incorrect attention toward them,

original: tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa des bdag la don ma yin pa rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa des bdag la don ma yin pa rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: that incorrect attention would lead to my detriment.

original: bde bar mi 'gyur zhing phan par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bde bar mi 'gyur zhing phan par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It would not be beneficial or pleasant for me.

original: de gang gi tshe reg bya de'ang ji lta ba bzhin du kun nas rtogs par 'gyur zhing tshul bzhin du yid la byed pas so sor rtog par byed pa na /
analyzed: de gang gi tshe reg bya de'ang ji lta ba bzhin du kun nas rtogs par 'gyur zhing tshul bzhin du yid la byed pas so sor rtog par byed pa na /
translated: When I understand tactile objects as they are and attend to them correctly,

original: de'i tshe 'di dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan par gyur pa'i sred pas gnod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'di dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan par gyur pa'i sred pas gnod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, he is not harmed by craving, which is associated with the delight and passion.

original: yul gyi stobs kyis kyang kun tu spyod par mi byed do //
analyzed: yul gyi stobs kyis kyang kun tu spyod par mi byed do //
translated: He does not engage in conduct that is based on objects.

original: thabs rnams thams cad kyi lus kyi reg bya rnams ji lta ba bzhin du kun tu brtags par gyur nas yid kyis kyang chos la kun tu lta bar byed do //
analyzed: thabs rnams thams cad kyi lus kyi reg bya rnams ji lta ba bzhin du kun tu brtags par gyur nas yid kyis kyang chos la kun tu lta bar byed do //
translated: He thoroughly investigates all the tactile objects that are related to the body and the mind observes entities.

original: ji ltar yid kyi chos rnams yin na /
analyzed: ji ltar yid kyi chos rnams yin na /
translated: “How are entities mental objects?

original: 'di na yid kyi rkyen dang chos kyi rkyen @124b las kyang yid kyi rnam par shes pa dge ba'am mi dge ba'am lung du ma bstan pa'ang skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di na yid kyi rkyen dang chos kyi rkyen @124b las kyang yid kyi rnam par shes pa dge ba'am mi dge ba'am lung du ma bstan pa'ang skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, mind consciousness arises in dependence on the mind and entities. It may be virtuous, nonvirtuous, or indeterminate.

original: de la gang gi tshe mi dge ba la dmigs par gyur pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes ba tshul bzhin ma yin pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe rig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la gang gi tshe mi dge ba la dmigs par gyur pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes ba tshul bzhin ma yin pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe rig par 'gyur te /
translated: When the mind consciousness that focuses on nonvirtue arises in an improper way, he knows that.

original: ji ltar bdag las skyes pa 'di ni /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag las skyes pa 'di ni /
translated: He knows, ‘This has arisen from me.

original: mi dge ba'i chos kyi dbang du byas pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa skyes pa yin la /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos kyi dbang du byas pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa skyes pa yin la /
translated: It is a mental consciousness that arises in relation to nonvirtuous phenomena.

original: dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang kun tu ldan pa'i sred pa yid la byung bas ni /
analyzed: dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang kun tu ldan pa'i sred pa yid la byung bas ni /
translated: Craving, which is associated with the pleasure-attractions, arises in the mind.

original: bdag don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: “I will be destroyed!”

original: phan par mi 'gyur zhing bde bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phan par mi 'gyur zhing bde bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: “I will not be benefited!” “I will not be happy!”

original: gang de kho na ltar chos rnams kyi 'byung ba dpyod par byed cing /
analyzed: gang de kho na ltar chos rnams kyi 'byung ba dpyod par byed cing /
translated: “One who investigates the arising of phenomena in just this way

original: de ltar chos rnams la chos kyis rjes su lta bas gnas par gyur pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar chos rnams la chos kyis rjes su lta bas gnas par gyur pa ni /
translated: and who abides in observing phenomena with the Dharma

original: chos rnams thams cad thams cad kyi yang rang gi mtshan nyid dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la ji lta ba bzhin du rjes su lta bas dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang lhan cig mtshungs par ldan pa'i srid pa'ang 'byung ba can gyi sred pa rnams kyis 'ching bar mi 'gyur
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad thams cad kyi yang rang gi mtshan nyid dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la ji lta ba bzhin du rjes su lta bas dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang lhan cig mtshungs par ldan pa'i srid pa'ang 'byung ba can gyi sred pa rnams kyis 'ching bar mi 'gyur
translated: will not be bound by the craving that arises in association with the pleasure-attractions in relation to any phenomenon whatsoever, through observing the specific and general characteristics of all phenomena just as they are.

original: ro // de dga' ba'i 'dod chags kyis byas pa'i sred pa de dag rnams las gol bas mchog tu bde ba dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ro // de dga' ba'i 'dod chags kyis byas pa'i sred pa de dag rnams las gol bas mchog tu bde ba dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: “ ‘They will transcend craving, which is created by attachment to pleasure, and thus they will experience supreme bliss.

original: chos rnams kyi'ang 'phel ba dang 'grib pa shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi'ang 'phel ba dang 'grib pa shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will also understand the waxing and waning of phenomena.

original: de ltar gang gi tshe ji lta ba bzhin du yul rnams thams cad la'ang so sor rtog par byed pa de'i tshe 'di la yang dag pa'i shes pa skye bar 'gyur @125a *//
analyzed: de ltar gang gi tshe ji lta ba bzhin du yul rnams thams cad la'ang so sor rtog par byed pa de'i tshe 'di la yang dag pa'i shes pa skye bar 'gyur @125a *//
translated: When they thus discern all objects as they are, they will give rise to genuine knowledge.

original: ro; ;de'i yang dag pa'i shes pa des nyon mongs pa rnams zad par byed do //
analyzed: ro; ;de'i yang dag pa'i shes pa des nyon mongs pa rnams zad par byed do //
translated: With that genuine knowledge, they will eliminate the afflictions.🔽With the afflictions exhausted, they will give rise to uncontaminated wisdom.

original: de nyon mongs pa zad pas kyang zag pa med pa'i ye shes skye bar 'gyur ro; ;de de dang yang dag par ldan pas go 'phang gi mchog 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyon mongs pa zad pas kyang zag pa med pa'i ye shes skye bar 'gyur ro; ;de de dang yang dag par ldan pas go 'phang gi mchog 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Endowed with that, they will attain the supreme state.

original: de ltar dge sbyong ngam bram ze'am gzhan yang de'i rigs can rnams kyis rtag pa nyid du yul rnams la yid ches par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar dge sbyong ngam bram ze'am gzhan yang de'i rigs can rnams kyis rtag pa nyid du yul rnams la yid ches par mi bya'o //
translated: Thus, mendicants, brahmins, and others of that kind should never trust in objects.

original: dgra lta bur gyur pa yin pa gang gi phyir yul rnams ni /
analyzed: dgra lta bur gyur pa yin pa gang gi phyir yul rnams ni /
translated: Therefore, one should remain indifferent to objects,

original: btang snyoms su gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: btang snyoms su gzhag par bya ste /
translated: as if they were enemies.

original: srog chags rnams thams cad thul 'og tu 'jug par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: srog chags rnams thams cad thul 'og tu 'jug par byed pa yin no //
translated: For, they are the ones who subjugate all living beings.

original: de'i phyir ji srid du zag pa med pa'i ye shes skyes par ma gyur bde srid du yul rnams la nam yang 'ga' zhig la yang yid ches bar mi bya'o //🔽rko trog can de dag ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji srid du zag pa med pa'i ye shes skyes par ma gyur bde srid du yul rnams la nam yang 'ga' zhig la yang yid ches bar mi bya'o // rko trog can de dag ni /
translated: Therefore, as long as the uncontaminated wisdom has not arisen, one should never trust any object.

original: grogs po'i gzugs su 'chos pa'i dgra rnams yin zhing /
analyzed: grogs po'i gzugs su 'chos pa'i dgra rnams yin zhing /
translated: They are the enemies who pretend to be friends.

original: 'khor ba'i 'ching ba rnams thams cad kyang de dag rnams yin no //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i 'ching ba rnams thams cad kyang de dag rnams yin no //
translated: They are the bonds of cyclic existence.

original: de nas de'i dus der rma bya'i mnga' bdag des tshigs su bcad pa brjod pa ji ltar /
analyzed: de nas de'i dus der rma bya'i mnga' bdag des tshigs su bcad pa brjod pa ji ltar /
translated: Then, at that time, the peacock king spoke these verses:

original: yul gyi de nyid mthong ba yis //
analyzed: yul gyi de nyid mthong ba yis //
translated: Seeing the reality of objects,

original: ye shes lcags kyus 'dzin par byed //
analyzed: ye shes lcags kyus 'dzin par byed //
translated: one is seized by the hook of wisdom.

original: des ma bzung bas mi bzang g-yo //
analyzed: des ma bzung bas mi bzang g-yo //
translated: Not seized by that, the evil one moves,

original: don min thams cad byed par 'dod //
analyzed: don min thams cad byed par 'dod //
translated: desiring to do all that is not good.

original: yul gyi bsam pa rmongs pa rnams //
analyzed: yul gyi bsam pa rmongs pa rnams //
translated: Those whose minds are confused about objects,

original: kun tu rtog pa snying la sams //🔽'tsho ba'i bsam pa kun sdom pa'i //🔽'chi bdag @125b zhags pa 'dir 'ong 'gyur //
analyzed: kun tu rtog pa snying la sams // 'tsho ba'i bsam pa kun sdom pa'i // 'chi bdag @125b zhags pa 'dir 'ong 'gyur //
translated: The mind is full of thoughts.🔽The noose of the Lord of Death🔽will come here, binding all thoughts of livelihood.

original: yang mo'i sems kyi srog chags rnams //
analyzed: yang mo'i sems kyi srog chags rnams //
translated: The life of a being is fickle,

original: yul rnams kyis ni yongs su drangs //
analyzed: yul rnams kyis ni yongs su drangs //
translated: drawn by objects.

original: gti mug gis ni yongs bslus pas //
analyzed: gti mug gis ni yongs bslus pas //
translated: Deceived by delusion,

original: kun rmongs kyis kyang shes pa yin //
analyzed: kun rmongs kyis kyang shes pa yin //
translated: it is also known as confused.

original: g-yo bas yul rnams thams cad ni //
analyzed: g-yo bas yul rnams thams cad ni //
translated: All objects are moving,

original: dri za'i grong khyer 'dra ba yin //
analyzed: dri za'i grong khyer 'dra ba yin //
translated: like a city of gandharvas.

original: sdug bsngal kun tu spel byed do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal kun tu spel byed do //
translated: They increase suffering

original: dmyal ba yi yang rgyu rnams yin //
analyzed: dmyal ba yi yang rgyu rnams yin //
translated: and are the cause of hell.

original: 'dod pas rnam rmongs byis pa rnams //
analyzed: 'dod pas rnam rmongs byis pa rnams //
translated: Fools are confused by desire;

original: yul rnams me yis sreg par byed //🔽sreg bzhin du yang mi go bar //
analyzed: yul rnams me yis sreg par byed // sreg bzhin du yang mi go bar //
translated: objects burn them with fire.🔽Even while being burned,

original: de nyid la ni yongs su 'jug /🔽kun rtog las ni 'dod chags skye //
analyzed: de nyid la ni yongs su 'jug / kun rtog las ni 'dod chags skye //
translated: they are not aware and enter into it.🔽Desire arises from conceptualization;

original: chags las khong khro rab tu 'jug /
analyzed: chags las khong khro rab tu 'jug /
translated: from desire, anger arises.

original: khro bas gzir ba'i skyes bu ni //
analyzed: khro bas gzir ba'i skyes bu ni //
translated: A person who is tormented by anger

original: dmyal ba'i rjes su rgyug par 'gyur //
analyzed: dmyal ba'i rjes su rgyug par 'gyur //
translated: will run after hell.

original: de phyir 'dod pa yongs su spongs //
analyzed: de phyir 'dod pa yongs su spongs //
translated: Therefore, give up desire.

original: mkhas pas khro ba zhi bar gyis //
analyzed: mkhas pas khro ba zhi bar gyis //
translated: The wise should pacify anger.

original: gti mug myur du yongs spangs nas //
analyzed: gti mug myur du yongs spangs nas //
translated: Having quickly abandoned delusion,

original: mya ngan 'das pa mngon du 'gyur //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa mngon du 'gyur //
translated: nirvāṇa will be actualized.

original: dgra bo bzhin du yul shes bya //
analyzed: dgra bo bzhin du yul shes bya //
translated: Objects should be seen as enemies,

original: grogs po dang 'dra mya ngan 'das //
analyzed: grogs po dang 'dra mya ngan 'das //
translated: nirvāṇa as a friend.

original: myang 'das yul can brtan pa ni //
analyzed: myang 'das yul can brtan pa ni //
translated: The stable one who has nirvāṇa as an object

original: mya ngan 'das pa rtogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa rtogs par 'gyur //
translated: will realize nirvāṇa.

original: de ltar rma bya rnams kyi bdag po des lha de dag rnams la gtsug lag gi mdo de dag ston par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar rma bya rnams kyi bdag po des lha de dag rnams la gtsug lag gi mdo de dag ston par byed do //
translated: In this way, the king of peacocks teaches those gods the sūtras of the scriptures.

original: chos gzhan yang legs par bsrung bar bya ba gces pa yod do //
analyzed: chos gzhan yang legs par bsrung bar bya ba gces pa yod do //
translated: There is another Dharma that should be cherished and well protected.

original: 'di'ang gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'di'ang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is this:

original: sems la yid ches par mi bya'o //
analyzed: sems la yid ches par mi bya'o //
translated: Do not trust the mind.

original: 'di na dge sbyong ngam bram ze'am gzhan yang de'i rigs can rnams kyis kyang ji srid 'tsho'i bar du de ltar sems la yid ches pas bgrod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di na dge sbyong ngam bram ze'am gzhan yang de'i rigs can rnams kyis kyang ji srid 'tsho'i bar du de ltar sems la yid ches pas bgrod par mi bya'o //
translated: Here, for as long as one lives, ascetics, brahmins, or others of that kind should not travel by trusting the mind in this way.

original: de @126a *// dag kyang gang gi phyir kun tu g-yo bar gyur pa bzlog tu med pa'i rang bzhin gyi gyus rnam par gnas pa med pa yul rnams la brkam par gyur pa yongs su skyes par byed pa 'dis kyang byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams thams cad dmyal ba
analyzed: de @126a *// dag kyang gang gi phyir kun tu g-yo bar gyur pa bzlog tu med pa'i rang bzhin gyi gyus rnam par gnas pa med pa yul rnams la brkam par gyur pa yongs su skyes par byed pa 'dis kyang byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams thams cad dmyal ba
translated: “Because of their nature, which is to be in constant motion and cannot be stopped, they are unstable and greedy for objects. This is how all ordinary, foolish people are led to wander in many ways through the realms of hell beings,

original: dang yi dvags dang dud 'gro rnams kyi 'gro ba la rnam pa du mar yongs su 'khyams par byed do //
analyzed: dang yi dvags dang dud 'gro rnams kyi 'gro ba la rnam pa du mar yongs su 'khyams par byed do //
translated: hungry ghosts, and animals.

original: nam zhig kyang 'di dag dang yongs su 'dris par 'gyur bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: nam zhig kyang 'di dag dang yongs su 'dris par 'gyur bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: They will never be free from them.

original: yul 'gyur zlog can 'di dag rnams kyis kun tu rmongs par gyur pas /
analyzed: yul 'gyur zlog can 'di dag rnams kyis kun tu rmongs par gyur pas /
translated: Because of these objects, which are by nature changeable, they are confused.

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams thams cad kyang dmyal ba dang yi dvags dang dud 'gro rnams su lan gcig dang / phyogs gcig ma yin par yongs su 'khor bar byed do //
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams thams cad kyang dmyal ba dang yi dvags dang dud 'gro rnams su lan gcig dang / phyogs gcig ma yin par yongs su 'khor bar byed do //
translated: Ordinary, foolish people are made to wander through the realms of hell beings, hungry ghosts, and animals, not just once, but again and again.

original: de lta na'ang skyo ba skye bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na'ang skyo ba skye bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And yet they do not become disillusioned.

original: de ltar de dag ni; thams cad 'jig par byed pa'i drag cing rtsub par gyur pa'i sdug bsngal can ni /🔽'khor ba yin /
analyzed: de ltar de dag ni; thams cad 'jig par byed pa'i drag cing rtsub par gyur pa'i sdug bsngal can ni / 'khor ba yin /
translated: Thus, this entire cyclic existence is a place of suffering, harsh and terrible.

original: de'i phyir shin tu mi bzad cing mchog tu drag par gyur pa'i sems 'di la ji srid dang ji srid du 'phags pa'i rgyas ma btab pa de srid du yid ches par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir shin tu mi bzad cing mchog tu drag par gyur pa'i sems 'di la ji srid dang ji srid du 'phags pa'i rgyas ma btab pa de srid du yid ches par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, as long as this most terrible and harsh mind has not been sealed by the noble ones, it should not be trusted.

original: ji srid du rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par ma gyur gyi bar du ste /
analyzed: ji srid du rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par ma gyur gyi bar du ste /
translated: As long as one has not attained the fruit of stream-entry,

original: phyi nas ni /
analyzed: phyi nas ni /
translated: afterwards,

original: ngan song gi sgo bcad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngan song gi sgo bcad par 'gyur ro //
translated: the door to the lower realms will be closed.

original: gzhan du na ni /🔽'gro ba rnams thams cad du rgyu ba dang sdug bsngal rnams thams cad bcas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na ni / 'gro ba rnams thams cad du rgyu ba dang sdug bsngal rnams thams cad bcas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise,🔽one will wander through all the realms of rebirth and experience all kinds of suffering.

original: 'ching ba rnams thams cad kyis bcings par @126b gyur pa rjes su 'brel ba rnams thams cad dang kun nas ldan pa mchog tu sgrub par dka' ba mchog tu gdul bar dka' bar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: 'ching ba rnams thams cad kyis bcings par @126b gyur pa rjes su 'brel ba rnams thams cad dang kun nas ldan pa mchog tu sgrub par dka' ba mchog tu gdul bar dka' bar gyur pa yin no //
translated: Bound by all the fetters, connected to all , endowed with all , one will be extremely difficult to liberate and extremely difficult to tame.

original: de'i phyir theg pa chen po la rab tu gnas pa'i dge sbyong ngam bram ze'am gzhan yang de'i rigs can rnams kyis kyang rung ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir theg pa chen po la rab tu gnas pa'i dge sbyong ngam bram ze'am gzhan yang de'i rigs can rnams kyis kyang rung ste /
translated: Therefore, those who are fully ordained, brahmins, or others of that type who abide in the Great Vehicle🔽

original: brgya la nam zhig kyang yid ches par mi bya'o //
analyzed: brgya la nam zhig kyang yid ches par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, even those who are monks, brahmins, or others of that kind who are well established in the Great Vehicle should never have faith in it.

original: de nas de'i tshe rma bya rnams kyi mnga' bdag des tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa ji ltar /
analyzed: de nas de'i tshe rma bya rnams kyi mnga' bdag des tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa ji ltar /
translated: Then, at that time, the lord of the peacocks spoke in verses:🔽Difficult to cross, quickly free from stains,

original: rgal dka' myur du dri bral dang // sems can kun la 'gyur ba che //
analyzed: rgal dka' myur du dri bral dang // sems can kun la 'gyur ba che //
translated: great change for all beings,🔽the mind

original: sems ni skye rgu thams cad la //
analyzed: sems ni skye rgu thams cad la //
translated: enters all living beings

original: rgyal po bzhin du rab tu 'jug /🔽mthong ba med dang 'jigs bcas pa'i //
analyzed: rgyal po bzhin du rab tu 'jug / mthong ba med dang 'jigs bcas pa'i //
translated: like a king.🔽This trembling of hell

original: las kyis dmyal ba g-yo ba 'di //
analyzed: las kyis dmyal ba g-yo ba 'di //
translated: through unseen and fearful karma,

original: gang gi sems 'dzin de shes rab //
analyzed: gang gi sems 'dzin de shes rab //
translated: that which holds the mind is wisdom,

original: de ni 'gro ba'i mchog tu 'gro //
analyzed: de ni 'gro ba'i mchog tu 'gro //
translated: it goes to the highest of migrations.

original: de bzhin bde ba'i gnas su gzhol //
analyzed: de bzhin bde ba'i gnas su gzhol //
translated: Likewise, it inclines to the state of bliss,

original: des ni ngan 'gro dag tu 'bab //
analyzed: des ni ngan 'gro dag tu 'bab //
translated: it descends to the lower realms.

original: de nyid btul bas dri med pa'i //
analyzed: de nyid btul bas dri med pa'i //
translated: By taming that very [mind],

original: mya ngan 'das pa rtogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa rtogs par 'gyur //
translated: one realizes stainless nirvana.

original: bde dang sdug bsngal byed pa sems //
analyzed: bde dang sdug bsngal byed pa sems //
translated: The mind is what creates happiness and suffering.

original: de btul ba las bde ba 'bab //
analyzed: de btul ba las bde ba 'bab //
translated: When it is tamed, happiness ensues.

original: las rnams rnam pa sna tshogs pa //
analyzed: las rnams rnam pa sna tshogs pa //
translated: All kinds of actions

original: sems kyi 'phen pa'i rjes su 'jug /
analyzed: sems kyi 'phen pa'i rjes su 'jug /
translated: follow the mind’s impetus.

original: de phyir sems ni rtag tu srungs //
analyzed: de phyir sems ni rtag tu srungs //
translated: Therefore, always guard the mind.

original: chos dang ldan pa'i longs spyod dag thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos dang ldan pa'i longs spyod dag thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: He obtains Dharma-endowed enjoyments.

original: le lo med par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: le lo med par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: He is not lazy.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pa dang byas pa shes par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pa dang byas pa shes par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: He knows what is to be done and what has been done.

original: rtag par rgyun du'ang 'chi ba rjes su dran pa sgom par byed do //
analyzed: rtag par rgyun du'ang 'chi ba rjes su dran pa sgom par byed do //
translated: He always practices the recollection of death.

original: 'chi ba'i dus na 'gyod pa med par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i dus na 'gyod pa med par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: He has no regrets at the time of death.

original: mthar yang yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthar yang yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the end, he attains nirvana.

original: de lta bu'i yon tan sum cu tham pa yin te; chos dang ldan pa'i 'chad pa po ma dang pha dang mtshungs par gyur pa'i chos kyi sbyin bdag chos sgrog pa po'i drung nas chos thos pa las yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i yon tan sum cu tham pa yin te; chos dang ldan pa'i 'chad pa po ma dang pha dang mtshungs par gyur pa'i chos kyi sbyin bdag chos sgrog pa po'i drung nas chos thos pa las yin no //
translated: These are the thirty qualities that come from listening to the Dharma from a Dharma teacher who is like a mother and a father, a benefactor of the Dharma.

original: de ni mthar thug pa dang mtha' yas pa'i phan pa byed pa'i phyir pha yin te /
analyzed: de ni mthar thug pa dang mtha' yas pa'i phan pa byed pa'i phyir pha yin te /
translated: He is a father because he benefits in the ultimate sense and in the infinite sense.🔽He teaches the Dharma in a way that is free of defilements, that is, in a way that is free of desire for gain, honor, and fame.🔽He teaches the Dharma in a way that is pure, that is, in a way that is free of the impurity of greed, hatred, and ignorance.

original: gang gis rnyog ba med pa dang yid rab tu rnam par drang par gyur pa dang phan par byed pa dang nges par rtogs par byed pas kyang chos ston par byed pa de ni /
analyzed: gang gis rnyog ba med pa dang yid rab tu rnam par drang par gyur pa dang phan par byed pa dang nges par rtogs par byed pas kyang chos ston par byed pa de ni /
translated: He teaches the Dharma in a way that is pure in its completion, that is, in a way that is free of the incompleteness of forgetting the words and the meaning.🔽He teaches the Dharma in a way that is pure in its cause, that is, in a way that is free of the cause of anger and so on.🔽He teaches the Dharma in a way that is pure in its result, that is, in a way that is free of the result of the obscurations of affliction and the knowable.🔽He teaches the Dharma in a way that is pure in its dedication, that is, in a way that is free of the dedication to the three vehicles.🔽He teaches the Dharma in a way that is pure in its wisdom, that is, in a way that is free of the obscurations of affliction and the knowable.

original: don de las sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun gyi bya ba byed pa yin no //🔽'khor ba las sgrol bar byed do //🔽'di na chos sgrog pa po chos brjod pa'i drung nas gang gi tshe chos nyan par byed pa na /
analyzed: don de las sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun gyi bya ba byed pa yin no // 'khor ba las sgrol bar byed do // 'di na chos sgrog pa po chos brjod pa'i drung nas gang gi tshe chos nyan par byed pa na /
translated: He teaches the Dharma in a way that is pure in its skillful means, that is, in a way that is free of the skillful means of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.🔽He teaches the Dharma in a way that is pure in its retention, that is, in a way that is free of the retention of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.🔽He teaches the Dharma in a way that is pure in its retention, that is, in a way that is free of the retention of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: dang po nyid @143a *//
analyzed: dang po nyid @143a *//
translated: He teaches the Dharma in a way that is pure in its retention, that is, in a way that is free of the retention of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.🔽He teaches the Dharma in a way that is pure in its retention, that is, in a way that is free of the retention of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: du de 'khor ba thog ma med pa'i dus nas 'jug pa las /
analyzed: du de 'khor ba thog ma med pa'i dus nas 'jug pa las /
translated: He teaches the Dharma in a way that is pure in its retention,

original: gal te shed na 'ga' zhig las chos thos par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te shed na 'ga' zhig las chos thos par 'gyur te /
translated: If he hears the Dharma from someone,

original: de chos sgrog pa de'i drung nas ma thos pa'i chos rnams thos par gyur nas ngo mtshar ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de chos sgrog pa de'i drung nas ma thos pa'i chos rnams thos par gyur nas ngo mtshar ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: he will be amazed to hear the Dharma that he has not heard before from that Dharma teacher.🔽Just as a person who is born blind, whose eye disease is cured by a great doctor,

original: ji ltar skyos pa nas long bar gyur pa'i mig gi nyes pa rnams sman pa chen pos gang gi tshe kun nas bsal bar gyur ba na; des du ma sna tshogs par gyur pa'i sa gzhi 'di mthong nas mchog tu dga' zhing rangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar skyos pa nas long bar gyur pa'i mig gi nyes pa rnams sman pa chen pos gang gi tshe kun nas bsal bar gyur ba na; des du ma sna tshogs par gyur pa'i sa gzhi 'di mthong nas mchog tu dga' zhing rangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: when he sees this variegated earth with its many things, he will be supremely delighted and overjoyed.

original: snga na med pa dang sngar ma thos pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i dga' bar gyur pa gzugs mngon par mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snga na med pa dang sngar ma thos pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i dga' bar gyur pa gzugs mngon par mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He will see forms that are delightful, various, and unprecedented, that he has never heard of before.

original: de bzhin du 'di'i thog ma med pa'i dus nas rab tu zhugs pa rnams kyang dam pa'i chos sgrog pa rnams 'dzin pa'i don gyis gang gi tshe byang chub kyi yan lag gis gzhi sna tshogs pa'i dge ba'i snying po dga' bar gyur pa sngan med pa'i mdo'i
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di'i thog ma med pa'i dus nas rab tu zhugs pa rnams kyang dam pa'i chos sgrog pa rnams 'dzin pa'i don gyis gang gi tshe byang chub kyi yan lag gis gzhi sna tshogs pa'i dge ba'i snying po dga' bar gyur pa sngan med pa'i mdo'i
translated: Likewise, those who have engaged in this since beginningless time are holders of the meaning of the proclamation of the excellent Dharma.🔽When the essence of virtue of various bases of the branches of enlightenment becomes joy, it is the unprecedented sutra.

original: don rnams rjod par byed pas gsal bar gyur pa mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don rnams rjod par byed pas gsal bar gyur pa mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, those who have been engaged in this since beginningless time, when they see the proclamation of the true Dharma being upheld, they become delighted by the various bases of the factors of awakening, the essence of virtue, and they clearly understand the meaning of the previously unheard sūtras.

original: de'i tshe shin tu bag yang rab tu yangs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe shin tu bag yang rab tu yangs par 'gyur te /
translated: At that time, they become very relaxed and open.

original: dmus long bzhin du gzugs rnams mngon par mthong nas rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dmus long bzhin du gzugs rnams mngon par mthong nas rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Like the blind seeing forms, they become overjoyed.

original: 'di ni / yon tan dang po yin no //🔽dam pa'i chos sgrog par byed pa rnams las des thos nas chos de dag rnams rab tu rig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni / yon tan dang po yin no // dam pa'i chos sgrog par byed pa rnams las des thos nas chos de dag rnams rab tu rig par 'gyur ro //

original: dam pa'i chos nyan par byed pas chos de dag thos par gyur nas yid kyis rab tu rtogs @143b par byed do //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos nyan par byed pas chos de dag thos par gyur nas yid kyis rab tu rtogs @143b par byed do //

analyzed: sgom par byed do //

analyzed: lan mang du byed do //

analyzed: bshad pa de la rab tu sgrub par byed do //

translated: With a very clear mind, he analyzes the words in the text, the topics, and the connections between the words and the topics.

analyzed: des ji lta ji ltar rnam par dpyad par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar don las mi nyung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The more he analyzes, the more he understands the meaning.

analyzed: des snga na med pa'i don rnams rnyed par 'gyur ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa rnams la 'bad par byed do //
translated: He strives to eliminate the afflictions because he has found a new meaning that he did not have before.

original: de kun tu sbyor ba rnams dang / rjes su 'brel pa rnams la'ang 'bad par byed pa dang / yon tan du ma rnams dang / tshul khrims dag shes rab dang / sbyin pa la de lta de ltar rjes su sgrub par yang byed do //

translated: He strives to eliminate the fetters and the bonds, and he practices generosity, morality, and wisdom in many ways.

original: gal te na bsam pa'i khyad par gyis dang / @144b sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang shes rab rnams la ste /
analyzed: gal te na bsam pa'i khyad par gyis dang / @144b sbyin pa dang tshul khrims dang shes rab rnams la ste /
translated: If he has a special intention, he practices generosity, morality, and wisdom.

original: 'di ni / dam pa'i chos sgrog pa bsten cing bsgoms la lan mang du byas pa'i yon tan bzhi pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni / dam pa'i chos sgrog pa bsten cing bsgoms la lan mang du byas pa'i yon tan bzhi pa yin no //
translated: This is the fourth quality of the one who has cultivated and frequently practiced the Dharma talk.

original: gzhan yang dam pa'i chos sgrog pa la legs par nyan cing legs par rab tu zhugs par gyur pa'i yon tan lnga pa yod de /
analyzed: gzhan yang dam pa'i chos sgrog pa la legs par nyan cing legs par rab tu zhugs par gyur pa'i yon tan lnga pa yod de /
translated: There is another fifth quality of the one who has cultivated and frequently practiced the Dharma talk, who has listened well and engaged well.

original: las rnam pa gsum po rnams kyi phyi nas bdag nyid shin tu brtan par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: las rnam pa gsum po rnams kyi phyi nas bdag nyid shin tu brtan par byed pa yin no //
translated: He makes himself very firm in the three kinds of actions.

original: chos 'dul ba de la rab tu 'god par byed do //
analyzed: chos 'dul ba de la rab tu 'god par byed do //
translated: He establishes others in the Dharma and the Vinaya.

original: ji ltar yang dge sbyong ngam bram ze'am khyim pa rnams kyis kyang 'di ltar rjod par byed de /
analyzed: ji ltar yang dge sbyong ngam bram ze'am khyim pa rnams kyis kyang 'di ltar rjod par byed de /
translated: In this way, the monks, the brahmins, and the householders say:

analyzed: ji ltar rigs kyi bu che ge mo zhig chos 'dul ba la legs par gnas par gyur te /
translated: “This son of such-and-such a family is well-established in the Dharma and the Vinaya.

original: de ni / ji skad brjod pa de ltar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni / ji skad brjod pa de ltar byed pa yin no //
translated: He does as he says.

original: bya ba'o // de ltar bdag nyid dang / gzhan dag kyang chos 'dul ba de la rab tu gnas bar byed do //
analyzed: bya ba'o // de ltar bdag nyid dang / gzhan dag kyang chos 'dul ba de la rab tu gnas bar byed do //
translated: In this way, he establishes himself and others in the Dharma and the Vinaya.

original: des ji lta ji ltar rab tu 'god par byed pa de lta de ltar 'khor ba'i skye ba brgya stong phrag bye ba khrag khrig dang / bskal pa brgya stong phrag bye ba nas bye ba rnams 'joms par byed do //
analyzed: des ji lta ji ltar rab tu 'god par byed pa de lta de ltar 'khor ba'i skye ba brgya stong phrag bye ba khrag khrig dang / bskal pa brgya stong phrag bye ba nas bye ba rnams 'joms par byed do //
translated: And the more he establishes others in the Dharma, the more he destroys hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of rebirths in cyclic existence, and hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of eons.

original: 'jigs par byed do //
analyzed: 'jigs par byed do //
translated: He terrifies them.

original: skye ba gzhan gang dag brgya stong rnams su dmyal ba dang yi dvags rnams su skye bar 'gyur ba rnams 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: skye ba gzhan gang dag brgya stong rnams su dmyal ba dang yi dvags rnams su skye bar 'gyur ba rnams 'gog par byed do //
translated: He stops the rebirths in other lives, in hundreds of thousands of rebirths in the hells and as hungry ghosts.

analyzed: 'di'ang dam pa'i chos bsgrags pa nyan cing bsten pa la bsgoms shing rnam par dpyad pa rnams kyi yon tan chen po gzhan yin no //
translated: This is another great benefit of listening to and relying on the proclamation of the true Dharma, reflecting on it, and discerning it.

analyzed: chos nyan par byed pa rnams la dam pa'i chos sgrog pa rnams ni /
translated: For those who listen to the Dharma, the proclamation of the true Dharma

analyzed: shin tu gces par gyur pa yin no // mya ngan las 'das pa nye bar @145a *//

analyzed: ston par byed pa'i phyir na don gyis na sangs rgyas yin no //
translated: in fact it is the Buddha.

original: gang gis chos kyi dbang du byas nas rab tu 'god par byed pa'i dam pa'i chos smra ba po de la bla lhag tu mthun par 'dzin pa dang gus pa chen po dang rab tu dang bar gyur ba rnams g-yo med pas ston pa bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis chos kyi dbang du byas nas rab tu 'god par byed pa'i dam pa'i chos smra ba po de la bla lhag tu mthun par 'dzin pa dang gus pa chen po dang rab tu dang bar gyur ba rnams g-yo med pas ston pa bzhin du bya'o //
translated: The one who is the Dharma teacher, who is the one who establishes the Dharma, should be treated like a teacher, with the utmost respect, with great devotion, with sincerity, with the utmost friendliness.

original: 'di ni / dam pa'i chos nyan pa'i yon tan lnga pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni / dam pa'i chos nyan pa'i yon tan lnga pa yin no //
translated: This is the fifth good quality of listening to the holy Dharma.

original: gzhan yang dam pa'i chos sgrog pa'i yon tan drug pa 'di dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang dam pa'i chos sgrog pa'i yon tan drug pa 'di dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six good qualities of proclaiming the holy Dharma?

original: 'di lta ste rang rab tu gnas par gyur nas gzhan yang rab tu gnas par byed cing /
analyzed: 'di lta ste rang rab tu gnas par gyur nas gzhan yang rab tu gnas par byed cing /
translated: Here, having become well-established oneself, one also establishes others.

original: gzhan dag rnams kyang rab tu dang bar byed do //
analyzed: gzhan dag rnams kyang rab tu dang bar byed do //
translated: One also inspires others.

original: gang dag gi skye ba gzhan brgya stong du dmyal ba dang yi dvags su skyes par gyur pa'i sdug bsngal du ma rnams bcom nas snod du byed do //
analyzed: gang dag gi skye ba gzhan brgya stong du dmyal ba dang yi dvags su skyes par gyur pa'i sdug bsngal du ma rnams bcom nas snod du byed do //
translated: One destroys the many sufferings of those who have been born in the realms of hell and hungry ghosts for hundreds of thousands of lifetimes, and makes them into suitable recipients.

original: 'khor ba las skyo ba skyed par byed do; ;bde legs yang dag par ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'khor ba las skyo ba skyed par byed do; ;bde legs yang dag par ston par byed do //
translated: He generates weariness with cyclic existence and he teaches the path to the transcendence of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dang lam gyi gtam byed do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dang lam gyi gtam byed do //
translated: He teaches the Dharma of suffering, its origin, its cessation, and the path.

original: de gnyis ka'i rgyud las bsod nams rab tu 'byung bar byed do; ;de rang gi rgyud la yang ste /
analyzed: de gnyis ka'i rgyud las bsod nams rab tu 'byung bar byed do; ;de rang gi rgyud la yang ste /
translated: He generates merit in the mindstreams of both himself and others.

original: de ni / bdag gzhan la phan par byed pa yin pas bsod nams chen po rab tu 'byung bar 'gyur ro //🔽ji lta ji ltar dam pa'i chos sgrog pa nyan par byed pa de lta de ltar shes rab mngon par 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni / bdag gzhan la phan par byed pa yin pas bsod nams chen po rab tu 'byung bar 'gyur ro // ji lta ji ltar dam pa'i chos sgrog pa nyan par byed pa de lta de ltar shes rab mngon par 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since he benefits both himself and others, he generates great merit.🔽The more he listens to the Dharma, the more his wisdom increases.

original: de lta de ltar nyon mongs pa rnams zad par byed do //
analyzed: de lta de ltar nyon mongs pa rnams zad par byed do //
translated: The more his wisdom increases, the more his mental afflictions are eliminated.

original: de nyon mongs pa rnams zad pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //🔽@145b dam pa'i chos sgrog pa'i yon tan ni /
analyzed: de nyon mongs pa rnams zad pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro // @145b dam pa'i chos sgrog pa'i yon tan ni /
translated: The more his mental afflictions are eliminated, the more he will attain complete nirvana.

original: de dag rnams yin no //
analyzed: de dag rnams yin no //
translated: These are the benefits of teaching the Dharma.

original: gzhan yang dam pa'i chos sgrog pa bsten cing bsgoms la lan mang du byas pa'i yon tan bdun pa yod do //
analyzed: gzhan yang dam pa'i chos sgrog pa bsten cing bsgoms la lan mang du byas pa'i yon tan bdun pa yod do //
translated: There is a seventh quality that comes from relying on, cultivating, and frequenting those who proclaim the sacred Dharma.

original: 'di'ang gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'di'ang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that quality?

original: 'di lta ste; rgud pas sems zhum par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di lta ste; rgud pas sems zhum par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One’s mind will not be discouraged by misfortune.

original: las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa rnams thos nas rgud pa zhum par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa rnams thos nas rgud pa zhum par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Having heard about the ripening of karmic actions, one will not be discouraged by misfortune.

original: bya ba ma yin pa rnams mi byed do //
analyzed: bya ba ma yin pa rnams mi byed do //
translated: One will not do what should not be done.

original: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa rnams rjod par yang mi byed do //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa rnams rjod par yang mi byed do //
translated: One will not say what should not be said.

original: bsam par bya ba ma yin pa'i bsam khral rnams sems par mi byed do //
analyzed: bsam par bya ba ma yin pa'i bsam khral rnams sems par mi byed do //
translated: One will not think about what should not be thought about.

original: 'di'i sems kyi dbang rab tu nyams par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di'i sems kyi dbang rab tu nyams par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One’s mental faculties will not deteriorate.

original: 'di ni / dam pa'i chos bsgrags pa'i yon tan bdun pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni / dam pa'i chos bsgrags pa'i yon tan bdun pa yin no //
translated: This is the seventh quality that comes from proclaiming the sacred Dharma.

original: gzhan yang dam pa'i chos bsgrags pa'i yon tan brgyad pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang dam pa'i chos bsgrags pa'i yon tan brgyad pa ni /
translated: “ ‘There is an eighth quality that comes from proclaiming the sacred Dharma.

original: yang gzhan dag la shes pa'am thos pa'am tshul khrims sam shes rab bam lung gis lhag pa mthong bar gyur nas nga rgyal dang ldan par mi byed par de dag dang lhan cig tu chos kyi mtshan nyid la rnam par dpyod par byed do //
analyzed: yang gzhan dag la shes pa'am thos pa'am tshul khrims sam shes rab bam lung gis lhag pa mthong bar gyur nas nga rgyal dang ldan par mi byed par de dag dang lhan cig tu chos kyi mtshan nyid la rnam par dpyod par byed do //
translated: Moreover, when he sees that others are superior to himself in knowledge, learning, morality, wisdom, or scriptural instruction, he does not become proud, but rather discusses the characteristics of the Dharma with them.

original: bshad pa de dang de dag gi don rnam par 'dres par 'gyur ba rnams kyang gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: bshad pa de dang de dag gi don rnam par 'dres par 'gyur ba rnams kyang gsal bar byed do //
translated: He also clarifies the meanings of the various explanations.

original: 'di ni / dam pa'i chos bsgrags pa'i yon tan brgyad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni / dam pa'i chos bsgrags pa'i yon tan brgyad pa yin no //
translated: This is the eighth good quality of the proclamation of the Dharma.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba ma skyes pa rnams skyed par byed do //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba ma skyes pa rnams skyed par byed do //
translated: “He causes roots of virtue that have not yet arisen to arise.

original: gang gi phyir dam pa'i chos bsgrags pa thos par gyur nas dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskrun pa rnams skrun par byed de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dam pa'i chos bsgrags pa thos par gyur nas dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskrun pa rnams skrun par byed de /
translated: Because, having heard the proclamation of the Dharma, he causes roots of virtue that have not yet arisen to arise.

original: dam pa'i chos sgrog pa rnams 'dod pas dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams skyed par byed pa ni /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos sgrog pa rnams 'dod pas dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams skyed par byed pa ni /
translated: He causes roots of virtue to arise through his desire for the proclamation of the Dharma.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: zhing gi rnang la sa bon @146a *//
analyzed: zhing gi rnang la sa bon @146a *//
translated: seeds are planted in a field

original: kun nas so sor btab par gyur pas myu gu rnams rab tu skye bar nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun nas so sor btab par gyur pas myu gu rnams rab tu skye bar nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: When they are well-planted, the sprouts are able to grow.

original: de kho na bzhin du brtson 'grus drag pa rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'ang chos nyan pa po rnams kyis chos sgrog par phyin cing chos smra ba'i drung nas dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sa bon rnams rna ba'i bu ga nas zhugs nas yid kyi zhing rnang la legs
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du brtson 'grus drag pa rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'ang chos nyan pa po rnams kyis chos sgrog par phyin cing chos smra ba'i drung nas dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sa bon rnams rna ba'i bu ga nas zhugs nas yid kyi zhing rnang la legs
translated: In the same way, the roots of virtue of those who are diligent, when they hear the Dharma, enter the field of the ear from the presence of the Dharma teacher, and are planted in the field of the mind.

original: par skye'o // chos kyi sa bon rna ba'i zhing rnang la rjes su zhugs pa de dus gzhan du 'bras bu rnam par rgyas par gyur pas dmyal ba dang yi dvags dang dud 'gro'i 'gro ba'i sdug bsngal gyi mu ge'i 'jigs pa rnams las yongs su skyo ba par byed do
analyzed: par skye'o // chos kyi sa bon rna ba'i zhing rnang la rjes su zhugs pa de dus gzhan du 'bras bu rnam par rgyas par gyur pas dmyal ba dang yi dvags dang dud 'gro'i 'gro ba'i sdug bsngal gyi mu ge'i 'jigs pa rnams las yongs su skyo ba par byed do
translated: The seeds of the Dharma that have entered the field of the ear, when they grow to fruition at another time, bring about complete relief from the famine of suffering in the realms of hell, hungry ghosts, and animals.

original: // de'i phyir de dag rnams las yongs su bskyabs par byas shing sdug bsngal de dag rnams thams cad kyang rab tu gzhom par byas la /
analyzed: // de'i phyir de dag rnams las yongs su bskyabs par byas shing sdug bsngal de dag rnams thams cad kyang rab tu gzhom par byas la /
translated: Therefore, they are completely protected from those realms and all those sufferings are overcome.

original: ngam grog rnams thams cad kyang bcad cing 'jigs pa rnams thams cad las grol bar byas nas zhi ba'i go 'phang bla na med par gyur pa'i bar du 'jug par byed do //🔽de nas ni /
analyzed: ngam grog rnams thams cad kyang bcad cing 'jigs pa rnams thams cad las grol bar byas nas zhi ba'i go 'phang bla na med par gyur pa'i bar du 'jug par byed do // de nas ni /
translated: He fills in the ravines and liberates from all fears until he reaches the unsurpassed state of peace.

original: mya ngan las 'das par zhugs par 'gyur ba yin no //🔽dam pa'i chos sgrog par byed pa de ni /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das par zhugs par 'gyur ba yin no // dam pa'i chos sgrog par byed pa de ni /
translated: Then he enters into nirvāṇa.

original: don de dag gi phyir na sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa byas pa yin no //
analyzed: don de dag gi phyir na sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa byas pa yin no //
translated: Because of these benefits, the one who teaches the Dharma performs the activity of the Buddha.

original: de'i phyir dam pa'i chos sgrog par byed pa de'i yon tan gzhan 'di dag yin te; gang dam pa'i chos rtag tu sgrog pa la 'gro ba dang bsnyen bkur byed pa dang sgrub par byed pa de dag rnams ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir dam pa'i chos sgrog par byed pa de'i yon tan gzhan 'di dag yin te; gang dam pa'i chos rtag tu sgrog pa la 'gro ba dang bsnyen bkur byed pa dang sgrub par byed pa de dag rnams ni /
translated: Therefore, the one who teaches the Dharma has these other qualities: those who always teach the Dharma, who serve and practice it,

analyzed: skyabs yin zhing 'khor ba las nges par 'byung bar byed pa'i sgo @146b yin no; ;dam pa'i chos sgrog par byed pa rnams la ni /
translated: are a refuge and the door to deliverance from saṃsāra.

original: yon tan gzhan dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: yon tan gzhan dag kyang yod do //
translated: The one who teaches the Dharma has other qualities as well.

original: 'di dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'di dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: 'di lta ste /🔽gong du skyong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste / gong du skyong bar byed pa'o //
translated: It is as follows:🔽It is the ripening of the roots of virtue.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams rgya chen por gong du yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams rgya chen por gong du yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: The roots of virtue are ripened in a higher and more extensive way.

original: gang 'ga' zhig chos sgrog pa la rtag tu nyan du 'gro bar byed pa'i brtson 'grus drag po dang ldan pa de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams ni /
analyzed: gang 'ga' zhig chos sgrog pa la rtag tu nyan du 'gro bar byed pa'i brtson 'grus drag po dang ldan pa de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams ni /
translated: The roots of virtue of those who are endowed with intense effort in going to listen to the Dharma teacher again and again are

original: phyi nas yongs su smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi nas yongs su smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: ripened later.

analyzed: dper na zhing gi rnang la sa bon rab tu btab par gyur pa las dus phyis nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis dang / dus kyi 'gyur ba las yongs su smin par 'gro'o //
translated: For example, seeds that are planted in a field are later ripened by the rays of the sun and by the change of seasons.

analyzed: de bzhin du phyi nas dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams shes rab kyi nyi mas yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: In the same way, the roots of virtue are ripened later by the sun of wisdom.

original: de'i phyir rtag par rgyun mi 'chad par dam pa'i chos bsgrags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtag par rgyun mi 'chad par dam pa'i chos bsgrags par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the proclamation of the holy Dharma is uninterrupted.

original: mnyan par yang bya'o //
analyzed: mnyan par yang bya'o //
translated: It should be listened to.

original: dam pa'i chos sgrog pa la yon tan gzhan yang yod do //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos sgrog pa la yon tan gzhan yang yod do //
translated: There is another quality of the proclamation of the holy Dharma.

original: 'di'ang gang dag zhe na /
analyzed: 'di'ang gang dag zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

analyzed: yongs su smin pa nges par grol bar byed do //
translated: One causes those who are fully matured to be liberated.

original: gang gi tshe sems la dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams yongs su smin par gyur pa de'i tshe 'di kho na la rtag tu 'gro ba dang 'dzin pa dang rnam par dpyod pa dang sgrub par byed pa'i rgyus sems kyi rgyud de yongs su spyad pa byas pa'i phyir
analyzed: gang gi tshe sems la dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams yongs su smin par gyur pa de'i tshe 'di kho na la rtag tu 'gro ba dang 'dzin pa dang rnam par dpyod pa dang sgrub par byed pa'i rgyus sems kyi rgyud de yongs su spyad pa byas pa'i phyir
translated: When the roots of virtue of the mind have become fully matured, then at that time, due to the cause of always going, holding, investigating, and practicing this very [mind], the continuum of mind is fully cultivated.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams 'joms par byed do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams 'joms par byed do //

analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams zad pas yongs su 'grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Through the exhaustion of the afflictions, one becomes completely liberated.

original: nges par rnam par grol ba rnams ni /
analyzed: nges par rnam par grol ba rnams ni /
translated: Those who are definitely liberated

original: chags pa med par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: chags pa med par 'gyur bas /
translated: become free from attachment.

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: They think like this:

original: bdag gi @147a *//
analyzed: bdag gi @147a *//
translated: “My own🔽

analyzed: skye ba rnams ni / zad de / tshangs par spyod pa ni /
translated: births are exhausted.🔽I have practiced pure conduct.

analyzed: spyad do // bya ba rnams ni / byas so // bdag gi sgrib pa gzhan rnams ni /
translated: I have done what needed to be done.

original: rab tu mi shes so //
analyzed: rab tu mi shes so //
translated: I do not see any other obscurations for me.

analyzed: de la yon tan de dag rnams thams cad kyang dam pa'i chos bsgrags pa las yin no //
translated: All these qualities come from proclaiming the holy Dharma.

original: de'i phyir na rgyun mi 'chad par chos mnyan par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir na rgyun mi 'chad par chos mnyan par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, you should listen to the Dharma without fail.

analyzed: yang thabs gzhan gyis nges par grol bar byed pa'i rgyu'i yon tan gzhan yod do //
translated: There is another quality that is a cause for liberation through another method.

original: 'di dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'di dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is this:

analyzed: log pa'i lta ba can rnams yang dag pa'i lta ba can du byed do // gang yang thog ma med pa'i dus nas 'khor pa'i bya ba ngan pa rnams kyis phyin ci log la rab tu zhugs pa'i 'gro ba rnams thos pa ngan pa rnams la kun tu 'jug par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Those who have wrong views are made to have right views.🔽Those beings who have been engaged in bad actions since beginningless time and have entered into error are made to engage in good actions through hearing.

original: thos pa ngan pas kyang dmyal ba dang yi dvags dang dud 'gro'i 'gro ba rnams su skye bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: thos pa ngan pas kyang dmyal ba dang yi dvags dang dud 'gro'i 'gro ba rnams su skye bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Through good actions, they are made to be reborn in the realms of gods and humans.

original: gang gi tshe dam pa'i chos nyan par byed pa dang dam pa'i chos sgrog pa bsten cing bsgoms la lan mang du byas par gyur pa na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe dam pa'i chos nyan par byed pa dang dam pa'i chos sgrog pa bsten cing bsgoms la lan mang du byas par gyur pa na /
translated: When one listens to the true Dharma, relies on the teacher of the true Dharma, meditates on it, and practices it frequently,

analyzed: de'i tshe log par lta ba da dang / ston cing sgom la lan grangs mang du byed par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then one will not have wrong views, nor will one teach, meditate on, or practice them frequently.

analyzed: de'i tshe 'di la bde ba rnams kyi mchog tu gyur pa dang / slu ba med pa'i yang dag pa'i ye shes 'char bar 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, the supreme bliss and infallible true wisdom will arise in one.

analyzed: de'i phyir na dam pa'i chos bsten cing bsgoms la lan mang du byas par gyur pa'i yon tan gzhan yang 'di dag yod do //

analyzed: skyes par gyur pa'i mi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rnam par rtog pa rnams so sor 'joms par byed do //

analyzed: yang dam pa'i chos bsgrags pa bsten cing bsgoms la lan mang du byas pa'i yon tan 'di dag ni /
translated: These are the qualities of relying on, meditating on, and practicing the true Dharma frequently.

original: gzhan yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yin no //
translated: It is the other.

original: 'di'ang gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'di'ang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.

analyzed: mi dge ba'i rnam par rtog pa nyung du tsam zhig yid la skyes par gyur kyang de'i tshe mi dge ba gnyen pos nges par 'joms par byed pa la 'di lta ste /
translated: Even if a few unwholesome thoughts arise in the mind, at that time, the unwholesome is definitely destroyed by the antidote, as follows.

analyzed: gang gi 'dod chags kyi rnam par rtog pa skyes par gyur na ni /

analyzed: de'i tshe mi sdug pa'i gnyen pos nges par 'joms par byed do //

original: gang gi tshe zhe sdang gi rnam par rtog pa skyes par gyur na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhe sdang gi rnam par rtog pa skyes par gyur na /
translated: When thoughts of hatred arise,

analyzed: de'i tshe byams pa'i rnam par rtog pas 'joms par byed do //

original: skyes @150b bu dam pa sten par byed pa rnams kyi yon tan gang dag 'thob par 'gyur ba yin na /🔽gal te yang skyes bu dam pa la bsten pas yon tan du ma rnams yod pa yin gyis kyang yon tan 'di ni /
analyzed: skyes @150b bu dam pa sten par byed pa rnams kyi yon tan gang dag 'thob par 'gyur ba yin na / gal te yang skyes bu dam pa la bsten pas yon tan du ma rnams yod pa yin gyis kyang yon tan 'di ni /

original: rab tu khyad par du 'phags pa yin te /
analyzed: rab tu khyad par du 'phags pa yin te /

analyzed: chos rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa thos par gyur nas g-yo dang ser sna rab tu 'joms par byed pa'o //

analyzed: 'di ni / g-yo dang ser sna dag gis ji ltar 'gyur ba yin no //

analyzed: de'i lus zhig par gyur nas shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song log par lhung nas yi dvags sam dmyal ba rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When his or her body breaks up, after death, he or she will fall into the lower realms and be born among the hungry ghosts or in hell.

original: des gal te dam pa'i chos bsgrags pa las las rnams kyi 'bras bu thob par gyur nas g-yo dang ser sna mang bar gyur pa yin na /
analyzed: des gal te dam pa'i chos bsgrags pa las las rnams kyi 'bras bu thob par gyur nas g-yo dang ser sna mang bar gyur pa yin na /
translated: If, on the other hand, he or she has heard about the results of actions from a teacher of the Dharma, and if he or she is very deceitful and greedy,

original: des rab tu 'joms par byed do //
analyzed: des rab tu 'joms par byed do //
translated: he or she will be overcome by that.

original: smre bar byed do //
analyzed: smre bar byed do //

original: gal te tha mal pa yin par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te tha mal pa yin par gyur na /

analyzed: smod par byed cing smre bar blta'o //
translated: he or she will be miserable and will be seen to be miserable.

original: bshags par byed do //
analyzed: bshags par byed do //

original: gzhan dag g-yo dang ser sna dang ldan par gyur na yang rab tu 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan dag g-yo dang ser sna dang ldan par gyur na yang rab tu 'gog par byed do //

original: smod par byed do; ;bshags su 'jug go /
analyzed: smod par byed do; ;bshags su 'jug go /

original: dge zhing legs pa'i lam dam par 'god par byed do //
analyzed: dge zhing legs pa'i lam dam par 'god par byed do //
translated: They are established on the excellent path of virtue and goodness.

original: de la yon tan de dag rnams ni /
analyzed: de la yon tan de dag rnams ni /
translated: “ ‘These qualities

original: dam pa'i chos bsgrags pa dang nyan pa las yin no //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos bsgrags pa dang nyan pa las yin no //
translated: are due to proclaiming and listening to the sacred Dharma.

original: de'i phyir na mi rnams kyi snying po ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir na mi rnams kyi snying po ni /
translated: Therefore, the essence of human existence

original: gang dam pa'i chos sgrog par byed pa de dag yin no //
analyzed: gang dam pa'i chos sgrog par byed pa de dag yin no //
translated: is to proclaim the sacred Dharma.

original: gzhan yang dam pa'i chos sgrog pa la yon tan yod do //
analyzed: gzhan yang dam pa'i chos sgrog pa la yon tan yod do //
translated: “ ‘There are also other qualities of proclaiming the sacred Dharma.

original: 'di yang gang dag zhe na /
analyzed: 'di yang gang dag zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: 'di lta ste /🔽ma dang pha @151a *//
analyzed: 'di lta ste / ma dang pha @151a *//
translated: They are as follows:

original: la gus pa dang ldan par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: la gus pa dang ldan par gyur pa'o //
translated: respect for one’s mother and father.🔽When one listens to the sacred Dharma, one will understand the ripening of karmic actions and the qualities of the fields.

original: dam pa'i chos thos par gyur pa gang gi phyir las rnams kyi rnam par smin pa dang zhing gi yon tan rnams kun tu rig par 'gyur te; ji ltar mchog tu gyur pa'i zhing de dag ni /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos thos par gyur pa gang gi phyir las rnams kyi rnam par smin pa dang zhing gi yon tan rnams kun tu rig par 'gyur te; ji ltar mchog tu gyur pa'i zhing de dag ni / 'di lta ste /
translated: The most excellent fields are

original: ma dang pha dag yin no //
analyzed: ma dang pha dag yin no //

analyzed: de gang gi tshe las kyi 'bras bu la yid ches pa mngon par skyes par gyur na /
translated: When one has developed trust in the ripening of karmic actions,

analyzed: de'i tshe sems la bsgoms nas ma dang pha dag la mchod par byed do //
translated: At that time, he should contemplate and make offerings to his mother and father.

original: rab tu phal che bar gyur pa'i nad kyi rkyen sman dang yo byad rnams kyi legs par sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: rab tu phal che bar gyur pa'i nad kyi rkyen sman dang yo byad rnams kyi legs par sbyor bar byed do //
translated: He should also prepare the best medicines and medical supplies for the sick.

analyzed: de ji lta ji ltar ma dang pha dag la mchod par byed par gyur pa de lta de ltar tshangs pa'i bsod nams 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The more he makes offerings to his mother and father, the more he will receive the merit of the heavens.

original: de dag gis mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gis mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will attain nirvana.

original: dam pa'i chos bsgrags pa las ma dang pha la mchod pa byed par gyur na /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos bsgrags pa las ma dang pha la mchod pa byed par gyur na /
translated: If he makes offerings to his mother and father by proclaiming the true Dharma,

original: yon tan gzhan 'di yang yod de /
analyzed: yon tan gzhan 'di yang yod de /
translated: he will have another quality:

original: skye bo rnams thams cad kyis bsngags par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: skye bo rnams thams cad kyis bsngags par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: he will be praised by everyone.

analyzed: mthong ba'i chos nyid la ma dang pha las bsngags par gyur la /
translated: In this very life he will be praised by his mother and father,

analyzed: lus zhig par gyur nas shi ba'i 'og tu mtho ris bde 'gro lha'i 'jig rten du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and when his body breaks up, after death, he will be reborn in a happy place, a heavenly realm.

original: rgyu de nyid dang rkyen de dag gis kyang mthar yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu de nyid dang rkyen de dag gis kyang mthar yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And by that cause and those conditions, they will eventually attain complete nirvāṇa.

original: de'i phyir yon tan de dag mngon par mthong bar gyur pa'i skyes bu mkhas pa rnams ni //
analyzed: de'i phyir yon tan de dag mngon par mthong bar gyur pa'i skyes bu mkhas pa rnams ni //
translated: Therefore, wise people who have seen these qualities

original: ji srid mtsho'i bar du ma dang pha @151b dag la gus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji srid mtsho'i bar du ma dang pha @151b dag la gus par 'gyur ro //
translated: will respect their parents as long as the ocean exists.

original: blo gzhan ma yin pa dang / spyod pa gzhan ma yin pa dang blo gros mnyam par bzhag par gyur pas spyod pa rnams kyang bsdams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: blo gzhan ma yin pa dang / spyod pa gzhan ma yin pa dang blo gros mnyam par bzhag par gyur pas spyod pa rnams kyang bsdams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because they are not of another mind, they are not of another practice. Because their minds are in equipoise, their conduct is restrained.

original: gzhan yang dam pa'i chos sgrogs pa yon tan gzhan yang yod do //
analyzed: gzhan yang dam pa'i chos sgrogs pa yon tan gzhan yang yod do //
translated: “ ‘There is another quality of those who proclaim the sacred Dharma.

original: 'di'ang gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'di'ang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: las kyi 'bras bu kun tu rig pa'o //
analyzed: las kyi 'bras bu kun tu rig pa'o //

original: las dang 'bras bu'i de kho na nyid gang zag gis mthong bar 'gyur pa ni /
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu'i de kho na nyid gang zag gis mthong bar 'gyur pa ni /
translated: The truth of actions and their results is seen by people,

original: dam pa'i chos sgrog pa ma gtogs pa gzhan gyis ma yin no //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos sgrog pa ma gtogs pa gzhan gyis ma yin no //
translated: but not by anyone else except those who proclaim the sacred Dharma.

original: de la gang gi tshe mi dge ba'i sems dang ldan pa'i mi dge ba la dmigs par gyur na de'i tshe mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: de la gang gi tshe mi dge ba'i sems dang ldan pa'i mi dge ba la dmigs par gyur na de'i tshe mi dge ba'o //
translated: When one has a nonvirtuous mind and focuses on a nonvirtuous object, then it is nonvirtuous.🔽

original: zhes so sor mngon par shes so //🔽gang gi tshe dge ba'i sems kun tu skyes par gyur pa na /🔽de'i tshe dge ba'o //
analyzed: zhes so sor mngon par shes so // gang gi tshe dge ba'i sems kun tu skyes par gyur pa na / de'i tshe dge ba'o //
translated: When he has an unwholesome mind and unwholesome objects, then he knows: “I have an unwholesome mind and unwholesome objects.”

original: zhes so sor rab tu shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes so sor rab tu shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: When he has a wholesome mind and wholesome objects, then he knows: “I have a wholesome mind and wholesome objects.”

original: des ji lta ba bzhin du las kyi 'bras bu rnams kun tu shes so //🔽ji lta ba nyid du mi dge ba'i sems bdag la skyes ba 'gyur pa'i mi dge ba'i sems de dag gis ni /
analyzed: des ji lta ba bzhin du las kyi 'bras bu rnams kun tu shes so // ji lta ba nyid du mi dge ba'i sems bdag la skyes ba 'gyur pa'i mi dge ba'i sems de dag gis ni /
translated: In this way, he knows his actions as they really are.🔽“When unwholesome thoughts arise in me,

original: phyi nas mi 'dod pa mi sdug pa'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa dmyal ba dang yi dvags dang dud 'gro rnams su bdag la 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi nas mi 'dod pa mi sdug pa'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa dmyal ba dang yi dvags dang dud 'gro rnams su bdag la 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: those unwholesome thoughts will bring about undesirable and unpleasant results in the future, such as rebirth in the hells, as a hungry ghost, or as an animal.”

original: gang gi tshe ngag gi nyes par spyod pa rnams byas par gyur pa de'i tshe 'di snyam du sems par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe ngag gi nyes par spyod pa rnams byas par gyur pa de'i tshe 'di snyam du sems par 'gyur te /
translated: “When I engage in verbal misconduct, I should think:

original: ji ltar mi dge ba'i las skyes pa 'di dag rnams kyis bdag la mi 'dod pa dang mi sdug pa dang yid du mi 'ong ba dang dmyal ba dang yi @152a *//
analyzed: ji ltar mi dge ba'i las skyes pa 'di dag rnams kyis bdag la mi 'dod pa dang mi sdug pa dang yid du mi 'ong ba dang dmyal ba dang yi @152a *//
translated: “ ‘In this way, I will understand that the unwholesome actions I have created will lead to undesirable, unattractive, and unpleasant results in the hells,

original: dvags dang dud 'gro rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dvags dang dud 'gro rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: among the pretas, and among animals.

original: gang gi tshe lus kyi nyes par spyod par byed pa rnams byed par gyur pa de'i tshe 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe lus kyi nyes par spyod par byed pa rnams byed par gyur pa de'i tshe 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: When I engage in unwholesome physical conduct, I will think,

original: ji ltar mi dge ba'i las skyes pa dang byas pa 'di dag gis ni /
analyzed: ji ltar mi dge ba'i las skyes pa dang byas pa 'di dag gis ni /
translated: “The unwholesome actions I have created and accumulated

original: dmyal ba dang yi dvags dang dud 'gro rnams su bdag la rnam par smin pa mi 'dod pa rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dmyal ba dang yi dvags dang dud 'gro rnams su bdag la rnam par smin pa mi 'dod pa rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: will ripen in the hells, among the pretas, and among animals.”

original: de la las kyi rnam par smin pa rnam pa gsum po 'di dag rnams kyang dam pa'i chos sgrog pa ma gtogs pa gzhan gyis ni shes par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de la las kyi rnam par smin pa rnam pa gsum po 'di dag rnams kyang dam pa'i chos sgrog pa ma gtogs pa gzhan gyis ni shes par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: “ ‘The ripening of these three types of actions cannot be understood by anyone other than the one who proclaims the Dharma.

original: de'i phyir na skyes bu dam pa rnams kyis ji srid 'tsho'i bar du dam pa'i chos sgrog pa dang mnyam par yang bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir na skyes bu dam pa rnams kyis ji srid 'tsho'i bar du dam pa'i chos sgrog pa dang mnyam par yang bya'o //
translated: Therefore, good people should proclaim the holy Dharma for as long as they live.

original: gang gi tshe dam pa'i chos sgrog pa rnams rjes su nyan par byed pa de ni /
analyzed: gang gi tshe dam pa'i chos sgrog pa rnams rjes su nyan par byed pa de ni /
translated: When they listen to the proclamation of the holy Dharma,

original: legs par spyod par byed pa yin no //🔽nyes par spyod pa rnams ni /
analyzed: legs par spyod par byed pa yin no // nyes par spyod pa rnams ni /
translated: they engage in good conduct.

original: yongs su spong bar byed do //
analyzed: yongs su spong bar byed do //
translated: They abandon bad conduct.

original: gzhan yang dam pa'i chos sgrog par byed pa la yon tan yod do //
analyzed: gzhan yang dam pa'i chos sgrog par byed pa la yon tan yod do //
translated: Moreover, there is another benefit in proclaiming the holy Dharma.

original: 'di'ang gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'di'ang gang zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is this:

analyzed: tshe ring po kun tu 'phel bar byed ba'i las rnams kyang 'di la mngon par 'phel bar 'gyur te /
translated: The actions that increase long life will increase for them.

original: de gang gi tshe dam pa'i chos sgrog par byed pa la ched cher gyur pa na /
analyzed: de gang gi tshe dam pa'i chos sgrog par byed pa la ched cher gyur pa na /
translated: When they are intent on proclaiming the holy Dharma,

original: de'i tshe las kyi 'bras bu'i de kho na nyid mthong bar gyur nas srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i mi dge ba'i las rnams mi byed do //
analyzed: de'i tshe las kyi 'bras bu'i de kho na nyid mthong bar gyur nas srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i mi dge ba'i las rnams mi byed do //

original: rgyun du yang dge ba'i las rnams bsten cing bsgoms la lan mang du byed par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyun du yang dge ba'i las rnams bsten cing bsgoms la lan mang du byed par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: They will always rely on, cultivate, and increase virtuous actions.

original: de dge ba'i @152b las de dag gi rnam par smin pas lha dang mi rnams su tshe ring bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dge ba'i @152b las de dag gi rnam par smin pas lha dang mi rnams su tshe ring bar 'gyur te /
translated: Due to the ripening of those virtuous actions, they will have long lives among gods and humans.

original: des de ltar dam pa'i chos bsten cing bsgoms la lan mang du byas pa'i phyir ro //🔽de'i phyir dam pa'i chos bsgrags pa'i yon tan 'di ni /
analyzed: des de ltar dam pa'i chos bsten cing bsgoms la lan mang du byas pa'i phyir ro // de'i phyir dam pa'i chos bsgrags pa'i yon tan 'di ni /
translated: This is because they have relied on, cultivated, and increased the sacred Dharma.

original: gzhan yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yin te /
translated: Therefore, this is another quality of proclaiming the sacred Dharma:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: namely,

analyzed: tshe ring por 'gyur ba'i las 'dis kun tu spel bar byed pa'o //
translated: that it increases the karma of long life.

analyzed: dam pa'i chos bsgrags pa'i yon tan gyi rgyu 'dis de dag thos nas kyang lha dang mi rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro // mi'i 'jig rten du skyes par gyur nas kyang de gal te lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur na /
translated: Having heard this cause of the qualities of proclaiming the sacred Dharma, they will be reborn among gods and humans.🔽If they are born in the human world, they will be born among the gods.

original: tshe ring ba'i lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe ring ba'i lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If they are born among the gods, they will be born among the gods with long lives.

original: khyad par du yang mdog dang gzugs dang 'od dang rtsed mos rnam par rgyu ba dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyad par du yang mdog dang gzugs dang 'od dang rtsed mos rnam par rgyu ba dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: In particular, they will have a good complexion, form, radiance, and playfulness.

original: dam pa'i chos bsgrags pa des gal te mi rnams su skyes par gyur na'ang de'i rigs dang gzugs dang phun sum tshogs pa dang yon tan dang tshe'ang ring bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos bsgrags pa des gal te mi rnams su skyes par gyur na'ang de'i rigs dang gzugs dang phun sum tshogs pa dang yon tan dang tshe'ang ring bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If they are born as humans due to the proclamation of the sublime Dharma, they will have a good family, form, and wealth, and will also have good qualities and a long life.

original: yul ljongs bzang por yang 'di skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul ljongs bzang por yang 'di skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be born in a good place.

original: de yang dag pa'i lta ba can du'ang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang dag pa'i lta ba can du'ang 'gyur ro //
translated: They will have right view.

original: dam pa'i chos de bsten cing bsgoms la lan mang du byas pa 'di ni /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos de bsten cing bsgoms la lan mang du byas pa 'di ni /
translated: Relying on, cultivating, and increasing this sublime Dharma

original: sdug bsngal las nges par 'byung ba gzhan yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal las nges par 'byung ba gzhan yin te /
translated: is another way to escape from suffering.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

analyzed: rab tu dang ba'i yid kyis dam pa'i chos bsgrags pa la gom pa 'dor bas tshangs pa'i bsod nams rab tu 'byung ngo //
translated: With a pure mind, one should take steps toward the proclamation of the sublime Dharma, and thus one will attain the merit of Brahmā.

original: dam pa'i chos sgrog pa las gang dag gis dam par byas te 'gro bar byed pa na /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos sgrog pa las gang dag gis dam par byas te 'gro bar byed pa na /
translated: Those who go to the proclamation of the sublime Dharma with a sense of urgency

original: de dag ni /
analyzed: de dag ni /
translated: will attain

original: lus kyi legs par spyod pa rnams la yang dag par @153a *//
analyzed: lus kyi legs par spyod pa rnams la yang dag par @153a *//
translated: and the good conduct of the body.🔽

analyzed: sbyor ba yin no // gang dag gis thos pa'i blo des de dag gis legs par spyod pa dang yang dag par ldan par 'gyur ro // gang thos par gyur nas yid rab tu dang ba skyes par gyur pas ni /
translated: He is one who is correctly engaged in the wholesome conduct of the body.🔽By means of the mind that hears the Dharma, he is one who is endowed with the wholesome conduct of speech.

original: des yid kyis legs par spyod pa rnams dang yang dag par ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des yid kyis legs par spyod pa rnams dang yang dag par ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: By means of the mind that hears the Dharma, he is one who is endowed with the wholesome conduct of mind.

original: de ltar chos bsgrags pa rnams legs par spyod pa gsum dang yang dag par ldan par gang gi tshe gyur pa na de'i tshe lha dang mi rnams kyi nang du skyes par gyur nas mchog tu skyid par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar chos bsgrags pa rnams legs par spyod pa gsum dang yang dag par ldan par gang gi tshe gyur pa na de'i tshe lha dang mi rnams kyi nang du skyes par gyur nas mchog tu skyid par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the proclamation of the Dharma is endowed with these three kinds of wholesome conduct, then, when one is reborn among gods and humans, one will experience the highest happiness.

original: tshe ring ba dang ldan par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe ring ba dang ldan par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: One will possess a long life.

original: de yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: One will attain complete nirvāṇa.

original: yon tan rnams thams cad ni /
analyzed: yon tan rnams thams cad ni /
translated: All the qualities

original: chos bsgrags pas 'thob par 'gyur gyi /🔽gzhan rnams kyis ni /
analyzed: chos bsgrags pas 'thob par 'gyur gyi / gzhan rnams kyis ni /
translated: are attained through the proclamation of the Dharma.

original: ma yin no //

analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid kyi sha'i gong bu'i mig gi rlung gi khams zhes brjod do //

translated: This body is like an illusion, a hollow deception, insubstantial like a mass of foam, a bubble, or a mirage, a source of suffering, a refuge for suffering, and a basis for the arising of suffering.

analyzed: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /

original: skyabs ni / gang yin /🔽skyob pa ni /
analyzed: skyabs ni / gang yin /🔽skyob pa ni /

analyzed: gang yin / 'di na ni ji ltar zhes des yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du lus la so sor rtog par byed do // de dag ni / 'di ltar yin te /

analyzed: lus 'di ni /

analyzed: dge ba'i las rnams dang ldan na lha dang mi rnams su'o //

analyzed: mi dge ba rnams dang ldan na dmyal ba yi dvags dud 'gro rnams su'o //
translated: If one has non-virtuous karma, one will be born as a hell being, hungry ghost, or animal.

original: lus 'di la ni /
analyzed: lus 'di la ni /
translated: In this body,

analyzed: rdzas sam gtsang ba'am snying po'am rtag pa'am brtan par gyur pa ni /

translated: One should contemplate this body as it is in reality. Then, one will completely abandon craving, which arises together with the desire and attachment for pleasure. ”

analyzed: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa mig de nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor rtog par byed de /

analyzed: ji ltar dzambu gling pa rnams kyi mi'i mig gis gzugs rnams snang ba dang nam mkha' dag las rjes su mthun pa mthong bar 'gyur ba de kho na bzhin du gnas gzhan gnas pa'i mi'i mig @172b gis gzugs rnams mthong ba yin nam zhes bya bar te / de nas legs par bsam zhing thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab bam lha'i mig gis kyang kun tu lta bar byed pa la ji ltar dzambu'i gling pa rnams kyi mig dang gzugs dang snang ba dang nam mkha' dang yid la byed pa'i rkyen de dag rnams las
translated: Do the eyes of humans in other abodes see forms in the same way that the eyes of humans in Jambudvīpa see forms in the light of space?

original: gzugs rnams legs par mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: gzugs rnams legs par mthong ba yin no //
translated: Then, having contemplated this well, they examine it with the wisdom derived from hearing or with the divine eye. They see that forms are well seen in Jambudvīpa due to the conditions of the eyes, forms, light, space, and attention of the beings there.

original: de bzhin du byang phyogs sgra mi snyan pa rnams kyi skyes bu song zhing nam mkha' la gnas nas gzugs rnams mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang phyogs sgra mi snyan pa rnams kyi skyes bu song zhing nam mkha' la gnas nas gzugs rnams mthong ba yin te /
translated: So too, the beings of Kuru in the north go to the sky and see forms there.

original: dper na / chu na chu la spyod pa'i nya la sogs pa rnams kyi gzugs mthong ba de bzhin du byang phyogs sgra mi snyan pa'i skyes bu ris bsgribs par gyur pa'i gzugs rnams kyang mthong ngo //

translated: For example, just as the forms of fish and so on that live in the water are seen by those who live in the water, so too the forms of beings of Kuru in the north who are obscured by the element of water are seen.

original: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa bdag nyid dzambu'i gling pa'i lus kyis byang gi sgra mi snyan pa'i lus la so sor rtog par byed de /🔽ji lta bu kho nar bdag gi rna bas mi 'dod pa'i sgra dang rab tu gsal ba rnams thos la bar chod pa rnams ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa bdag nyid dzambu'i gling pa'i lus kyis byang gi sgra mi snyan pa'i lus la so sor rtog par byed de / ji lta bu kho nar bdag gi rna bas mi 'dod pa'i sgra dang rab tu gsal ba rnams thos la bar chod pa rnams ni /
translated: Moreover, yogis and yoginis who have a Jambudvīpa body investigate the bodies of beings in Kuru in the north.🔽Just as I hear sounds that are not desired and are very clear with my ears but do not hear those that are obstructed,

analyzed: ma yin zhing de bzhin du sgra chen po rnams ni bdag cag gis thos pa yin na /

analyzed: de kho na bzhin du byang phyogs sgra mi snyan pa rnams yin nam mi ste ma yin zhes de yang dag pa ji lta bzhin du rna bas so sor rtog par byed de / thag nye bar rnams dang rgyang ring ba rnams dang dman pa rnams dang snyan pa rnams dang mi snyan pa'i sgra rnams kyang chos nyid kyi khyad par gyis byang phyogs sgra mi snyan pa'i skyes bus @173a *//
translated: In the same way, are the sounds of the northern continent of Kuru heard or not?

original: thos pa yin te /
analyzed: thos pa yin te /
translated: He hears sounds of those near and far, of those inferior and superior, and of those pleasant and unpleasant, because of the special nature of the northern continent of Kuru.

original: ji ltar nyi mas thag nye ba dang rgyang ring ba dang phal che ba dang gzugs dman pa dang mi gtsang ba rnams kyang gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar nyi mas thag nye ba dang rgyang ring ba dang phal che ba dang gzugs dman pa dang mi gtsang ba rnams kyang gsal bar byed do //
translated: Just as the sun illuminates those near and far, the majority, inferior forms, and impurities,

original: de bzhin du byung phyogs sgra mi snyan pa'i mi rnams kyis kyang sgra thos so //🔽gzhan yang rnal 'byor spyod pa lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
